q_en: Which cutting tasks are for products categorized as T-shirt?
gt:
Sure thing! Let's dive into the cutting tasks for products categorized as "T-shirt". Here's what I found for you:

| Task ID | Start Time          | End Time            | Working Group Name | Product ID |
|---------|---------------------|---------------------|--------------------|------------|
| 1       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-01-18 00:00:00 | Master Sewers      | 1          |
| 3       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-01-19 00:00:00 | Master Cutters     | 3          |
| 4       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-01-17 00:00:00 | Master Sewers      | 11         |
| 2       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-02-02 00:00:00 | Master Cutters     | 19         |
| 5       | 2024-01-10 00:00:00 | 2024-02-02 00:00:00 | Master Sewers      | 27         |

These tasks are all set for products that fall under the "T-shirt" category. If you have any more questions or need further details, feel free to ask! üòÑ

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM products WHERE products_type_id = (SELECT id FROM products_types WHERE description = 'T-shirt');
steps.description: Retrieve the product IDs for products categorized as "T-shirt"

steps.sql: SELECT ct.id, ct.start_time, ct.end_time, wg.name AS working_group_name, op.product_id FROM cutting_tasks ct JOIN order_product op ON ct.order_product_id = op.id JOIN working_group wg ON ct.working_group_id = wg.id WHERE op.product_id IN (1, 3, 11, 19, 27);
steps.description: Retrieve the cutting task details for the products identified in Step1
